ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Implements the One Rule (OneR) Machine Learning classification algorithm (Holte, R.C. (1993) <doi:10.1023/A:1022631118932>) with enhancements for sophisticated handling of numeric data and missing values together with extensive diagnostic functions. It is useful as a baseline for machine learning models and the rules are often helpful heuristics.

Implements the One Rule (OneR) Machine Learning classification algorithm (Holte, R.C. (1993) <doi:10.1023/A:1022631118932>) with enhancements for sophisticated handling of numeric data and missing values together with extensive diagnostic functions. It is useful as a baseline for machine learning models and the rules are often helpful heuristics.

name: r-oner
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '2.2' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-oner
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/OneR_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/OneR/OneR_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 62ab3f94a45451d68212ad0c94647fc570b33cc88169f749f46215cc19fcf9cc

build:
  number: 4
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
  run:
    - r-base

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('OneR')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('OneR')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/vonjd/OneR
  license: MIT
  summary: Implements the One Rule (OneR) Machine Learning classification algorithm (Holte, R.C.
    (1993) <doi:10.1023/A:1022631118932>) with enhancements for sophisticated handling
    of numeric data and missing values together with extensive diagnostic functions.
    It is useful as a baseline for machine learning models and the rules are often helpful
    heuristics.
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
